page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area of this survey covers 12 square kilometers of mainly arable land on the coastal plain between the South Downs and the English Channel just to the SW of the city of Chichester. The land is very flat, heights ranging between 3 and 13 metres above sea level. In common with the rest of Central Southern England we do not experience extremes of temperatures - the winters being comparatively mild and the summers warm and sunny - hence the extensive greenhouses. As well as the scattered farmsteads the area includes part of Runcton and Oving and the hamlet of Merston, all pleasant residential areas. The Portsmouth to Brighton/London Railway Line crosses the area, the busy A27 runs E to W to the north and feeds the A259 and B2166 both leading to Bognor Regis and sea.
